intro: Paullinia livescens, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a member of the Sapotaceae family. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has simple, opposite, and usually elliptical leaves that are glossy and dark green in color. Its flowers are small, greenish-yellow, and clustered in panicles, while the fruit is a fleshy, orange-red berry that contains several seeds. The plant is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and secondary forests.
